paper.abstract: Although planning is a crucial information management issue, it must be seen as only one facet of an organizationu0027s complete program for information technology management. Attention in this article is first directed toward understanding the larger management context within which planning activities are likely to transpire. The paper then describes a vew of planning appropriate for the 1990u0027s and identifies contributions form the information technology (IT) planning literature likely to facilitate IT planning efforts.
